page.title: 05Farming_continued.
page.content: The farmhouses are not only isolated geographically but also in terms of public services and amenities.Most now have mains electricity,though not all;the odd one or two still have their own generators.They all need their own private water supply and sewage system.Until quite recent times hand pumps were still in operation, pumping water from old wells.Today some farms have their own boreholes sunk into the sand stone, to a depth of up to two hundred feet,and the water is pumped up electrically into the farm houses.Some, however, still use the wells that have been in existence since the house was erected, which more often than not, was over two hundred years ago.There is no gas at all in the area.
